snippet: Waltzing out of the Lively Morgue come the brides from Times past, well-to-do women of the 1920s and ’30s, whose studio portraits were made at a time when the country’s economy and marriage rates were plunging.
abstract: Waltzing out of the Lively Morgue come the brides from Times past, well-to-do women of the 1920s and ’30s, whose studio portraits were made at a time when the country’s economy and marriage rates were plunging.

byline.original: By JOHN LELAND and DARCY EVELEIGH

headline.main: From the Archive Come Brides of The Times
